doc.field:
NOTE: As part of the Omnibus Tax Bill which was listed as 2001 Special Session, Chapter 5, the transit taxing district is no longer used for tax assessment purposes.
The Transit Capital Levy Communities dataset includes all the communities in the transit taxing district on 1/1/2001 AND communities that have come to an agreement with the Metropolitan Council to levy in their community for transit capital. The transit taxing district was the area in which all taxable property was assessed a tax to be used for payment of transit and paratransit services per Minn. Stat. 473.446. This area was comprised of whole cities, townships and unorganized territories.

<?xml version="1.0"?><metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><title>Transit Capital Levy Communities 2013</title><origin>Metropolitan Council</origin><pubinfo><publish>Metropolitan Council</publish></pubinfo><pubdate>Periodically revised</pubdate><onlink>ftp://gisftp.metc.state.mn.us/TransitCapitalLevyCommunities.zip</onlink></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>NOTE: As part of the Omnibus Tax Bill which was listed as 2001 Special Session, Chapter 5, the transit taxing district is no longer used for tax assessment purposes.
The Transit Capital Levy Communities dataset includes all the communities in the transit taxing district on 1/1/2001 AND communities that have come to an agreement with the Metropolitan Council to levy in their community for transit capital. The transit taxing district was the area in which all taxable property was assessed a tax to be used for payment of transit and paratransit services per Minn. Stat. 473.446. This area was comprised of whole cities, townships and unorganized territories.</abstract><purpose>To depict the extent of the community where the Metropolitan Council levies for transit capital for general mapping and analysis purposes.</purpose><supplinf>Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20140401</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>The transit capital levy communities dataset includes all communities as of the time period of content date above. Recent additions to the Transit Capital Levy Communities: Lakeville (2009), Forest Lake (2010), Columbus (2010), Maple Plain (2011), Ramsey (2013).
The city and township boundaries used to create this dataset were derived from the metro wide city and township boundary dataset described at http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/CountiesAndCTUs.htm That dataset is updated on a quarterly basis. This dataset is then recreated quarterly from those boundaries. The time period of content date is the last update based on a municipality change.</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>As Needed</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-93.697365</westbc><eastbc>-92.760683</eastbc><northbc>45.242099</northbc><southbc>44.687444</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><place><placekey>Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County</placekey></place><theme><themekey>transit capital levy communities, transit taxing district, transit system, buses, Metro Transit, administrative cities have been verified to be in the transit taxing district or have come to an agreement with the Metropolitan Council to collect a levy for transit capital</attraccr></attracc><logic>The dataset is topologically 'clean'.</logic><complete>Entire seven county geographic area is covered.</complete><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>Because this dataset is derived directly from the MetroGIS regional municipal boundary layer, it's positional accuracy is identical to that dataset. http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/CountiesAndCTUs.htm</horizpar></horizpa></posacc><lineage><procstep><procdesc>This layer was created by relating a table of municipalities within the Transit Taxing District to the municipal boundary layer.</procdesc></procstep><srcinfo><srcscale Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a web mapping service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/.
